bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Definitions

bcl:definition.bcl:text: timber harvesting land base means the current timber harvesting land base for a tree farm licence area or a timber supply area, whichever is applicable, as set out in the most recent allowable annual cut determination for the area.

bcl:part.bcl:text: Reduction Among Forest Licences in Timber Supply Area

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Base-level allowable annual cut
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of the definition of "base-level allowable annual cut" in section 62.1 of the Act, the allowable annual cut prescribed as the base-level allowable annual cut for ungrouped licences and groups of licences is 10 001 m3.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Allowable annual cut available to holder of tree farm licence
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of paragraph (a) of the definition of "allowable annual cut available" in section 1 (1) of the Act, the allowable annual cut available to the holder of a tree farm licence is the allowable annual cut of the tree farm licence area minus

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the allowable annual cut attributed to a reservation referred to in section 35 (1) (h) of the Act, except the portion of the reservation attributed to a deletion of Crown land from the tree farm licence area under section 39.1 of the Act if the agreement making the deletion states that the deletion of Crown land is to offset a reservation referred to in section 35 (1) (h) of the Act, and

the reduction to the allowable annual cut attributed to the tree farm licence under section 3 (3) of the Forestry Revitalization Act, except the portion of the reduction attributed to a deletion of Crown land from the tree farm licence area

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: by order of the minister under section 3 (4) of that Act, or
under section 39.1 of the Forest Act, if the agreement making the deletion states that the deletion of Crown land is to offset a reduction under section 3 (3) of the Forestry Revitalization Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Allowable annual cut available to holder of community forest agreement
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of paragraph (b) of the definition of "allowable annual cut available" in section 1 (1) of the Act, the allowable annual cut available to the holder of a community forest agreement is the allowable annual cut of the community forest agreement area minus the amount of timber that, under section 43.3 (1) (g.2) of the Act, is specified to be reserved and available for disposition to persons other than the holder of the community forest agreement.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Allowable annual cut available to holder of first nations woodland licence
bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of paragraph (c) of the definition of "allowable annual cut available" in section 1 (1) of the Act, the allowable annual cut available to the holder of a first nations woodland licence is the allowable annual cut of the first nations woodland licence area minus the amount of timber that, under section 43.55 (1) (h.1) of the Act, is specified to be reserved and available for disposition to persons other than the holder of the first nations woodland licence.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: For the purposes of section 8.1 of the Act
bcl:section.bcl:text: Sections 5 to 13 of this regulation are for the purposes of section 8.1 of the Act.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Boundary changes to a timber supply area

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the minister changes the boundary of a timber supply area under section 7 of the Act by removing land from the timber supply area and the area of land that is removed has an allowable annual cut attributed to it under section 8 (5) (a.1) of the Act, the allowable annual cut of the timber supply area is, after the boundary of the timber supply area is changed, the allowable annual cut of the timber supply area as it was immediately before the change to the boundary of the timber supply area minus the allowable annual cut attributed to the area of land that is removed from the timber supply area.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: subsection (1) does not apply,
the minister changes the boundary of a timber supply area under section 7 of the Act by removing land from the timber supply area, and
as a result of paragraph (b), the timber harvesting land base of the timber supply area from which the land is removed decreases by at least 200 hectares,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the allowable annual cut of the timber supply area is, after the boundary of the timber supply area is changed, the allowable annual cut of the timber supply area as it was immediately before the change to the boundary of the timber supply area minus the amount obtained by applying the following formula:

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Consolidation of timber supply areas
bcl:section.bcl:text: If the minister orders the consolidation of 2 or more timber supply areas under section 7 of the Act, the allowable annual cut of the timber supply area resulting from the consolidation is the total of the allowable annual cuts of all of the timber supply areas that were consolidated as they were immediately before the consolidation.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Division of timber supply areas

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the minister orders the division of a timber supply area under section 7 of the Act by removing land from the area of the timber supply area and adding the land to the area of another timber supply area or establishing a new timber supply area, and an allowable annual cut has been attributed to that land under section 8 (5) (a.1) of the Act, the allowable annual cut of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the timber supply area from which the land is removed is, after the removal of the land, the allowable annual cut of the timber supply area as it was immediately before the removal of the land minus the allowable annual cut attributed to the area of land removed from the timber supply area,

the timber supply area to which the land is added, if applicable, is, after the addition of the land, the allowable annual cut of the timber supply area as it was immediately before the addition of the land plus the allowable annual cut attributed to the area of land added to the timber supply area, and
the new timber supply area, if applicable, is the allowable annual cut attributed to the area of land added to establish the new timber supply area.
subsection (1) does not apply,

as a result of paragraph (b) the timber harvesting land base of the timber supply area from which that land was removed decreases by at least 200 hectares,

the timber supply area from which the land is removed is, after the removal of the land, the allowable annual cut of the timber supply area as it was immediately before the removal of the land minus the amount obtained by applying the following formula:

the new timber supply area, if applicable, is the amount obtained by applying the formula set out in paragraph (d).

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Surrender of tree farm licence for forest licence
bcl:section.bcl:text: If a tree farm licence is surrendered under section 16 of the Act for replacement by a forest licence, the allowable annual cut of the timber supply area in which the tree farm licence area is located is, after the forest licence is entered into, the allowable annual cut of the timber supply area as it was immediately before the forest licence is entered into plus the allowable annual cut of the Crown land portion of the tree farm licence area as it was immediately before the tree farm licence was surrendered.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Boundary or area changes to a tree farm licence area

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the minister changes the boundary or area of a tree farm licence under section 39.1 of the Act by adding Crown land to the area of the licence and the minister specifies in the instrument making the change the allowable annual cut of the area of Crown land that is added, the allowable annual cut of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the tree farm licence area is, after the boundary or area of the licence is changed, the allowable annual cut of the tree farm licence as it was immediately before the change to the boundary or area of the licence plus the allowable annual cut of the area of Crown land added to the licence, and

the timber supply area in which the tree farm licence is located is, after the boundary or area of the licence is changed, the allowable annual cut of the timber supply area as it was immediately before the change to the boundary or area of the licence minus the allowable annual cut of the area of Crown land added to the licence.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the minister changes the boundary or area of a tree farm licence under section 39.1 of the Act by removing land from the area of the licence and the minister specifies in the instrument making the change the allowable annual cut of the area of land that is removed, the allowable annual cut of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the tree farm licence area is, after the boundary or area of the licence is changed, the allowable annual cut of the tree farm licence area as it was immediately before the change to the boundary or area of the licence minus the allowable annual cut of the area of land removed from the licence, and

the timber supply area in which the tree farm licence is located is, after the boundary or area of the licence is changed, the allowable annual cut of the timber supply area as it was immediately before the change to the boundary or area of the licence plus the allowable annual cut of the Crown land portion of the area of land removed from the licence.
subsection (1) does not apply,
the minister changes the boundary or area of a tree farm licence under section 39.1 of the Act by adding Crown land to the area of the licence, and
the area of Crown land that is added has an allowable annual cut attributed to it under section 8 (5) (a.1) of the Act,

the tree farm licence area is, after the boundary or area of the licence is changed, the allowable annual cut of the tree farm licence area as it was immediately before the change to the boundary or area of the licence plus the allowable annual cut referred to in paragraph (c), and

the timber supply area in which the tree farm licence is located is, after the boundary or area of the licence is changed, the allowable annual cut of the timber supply area as it was immediately before the change to the boundary or area of the licence minus the allowable annual cut referred to in paragraph (c).
subsection (2) does not apply,

the area of land that is removed has an allowable annual cut attributed to it under section 8 (5) (a.1) of the Act,

the tree farm licence area is, after the boundary or area of the licence is changed, the allowable annual cut of the tree farm licence area as it was immediately before the change to the boundary or area of the licence minus the allowable annual cut referred to in paragraph (c), and

the timber supply area in which the tree farm licence is located is, after the boundary or area of the licence is changed, the allowable annual cut of the timber supply area as it was immediately before the change to the boundary or area of the licence plus the allowable annual cut referred to in paragraph (c).
subsections (1) and (3) do not apply,

as a result of paragraph (b), the timber harvesting land base of the licence to which the Crown land is added increases by at least 200 hectares,

the tree farm licence area is, after the boundary or area of the licence is changed, the allowable annual cut of the tree farm licence area as it was immediately before the change to the boundary or area of the licence plus the amount obtained by applying the following formula:

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Changes to a tree farm licence area under the Forestry Revitalization Act

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section adjustment date means

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the date the minister's order under section 3 (4) of the Forestry Revitalization Act is made, if no subsequent date is specified for the purpose of section 3 (5.1) of the Forestry Revitalization Act, or
the subsequent date, if one is specified for the purpose of section 3 (5.1) of the Forestry Revitalization Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If, after this section comes into force, the minister makes an order under section 3 (4) of the Forestry Revitalization Act deleting an area of Crown land from a tree farm licence area and the minister specifies in the order the allowable annual cut of the area of land that is deleted, the allowable annual cut of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the tree farm licence area is, effective on the adjustment date, the allowable annual cut of the tree farm licence area as it was immediately before the adjustment date minus the allowable annual cut of the area of land deleted from the tree farm licence area, and

the timber supply area in which the tree farm licence is located is, effective on the adjustment date, the allowable annual cut of the timber supply area as it was immediately before the adjustment date plus the allowable annual cut of the area of land deleted from the tree farm licence area.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Consolidation of tree farm licences

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In subsection (2), replacement tree farm licence area means the area of the tree farm licence that replaces 2 or more tree farm licences under section 39 (2) (a) or (3) (a) of the Act.

If the minister, under section 39 (2) (a) or (3) (a) of the Act, replaces 2 or more tree farm licences with one of those tree farm licences, the allowable annual cut of the replacement tree farm licence area is, after the licences are replaced, the total of the allowable annual cuts of all the replaced tree farm licence areas, including the replacement tree farm licence area, as they were immediately before the licences were replaced.

If the minister, under section 39 (2) (a) or (3) (a) of the Act, replaces 2 or more tree farm licences with a new tree farm licence, the allowable annual cut of the new tree farm licence area is, after the licences are replaced, the total of the allowable annual cuts of all the replaced tree farm licence areas as they were immediately before the licences were replaced.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Subdivision of tree farm licences

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If the minister, under section 39 (2) (b) or (3) (b) of the Act, amends a single tree farm licence by removing land from the area of the licence and adding the land to the area of another tree farm licence or establishing a new tree farm licence, and the minister specifies in the instrument making the change the allowable annual cut of the area of that land, the allowable annual cut of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the tree farm licence area from which the land is removed is, after the removal of the land, the allowable annual cut of the tree farm licence area as it was immediately before the removal of the land minus the allowable annual cut of the area of land removed from the licence,

the tree farm licence area to which all of part of the land is added, if applicable, is, after the addition of the land, the allowable annual cut of the tree farm licence area as it was immediately before the addition of the land plus the allowable annual cut of the area of land added to the licence as specified by the minister in the instrument making the change, and
new tree farm licence area, if applicable, is the allowable annual cut of the land added to establish the new tree farm licence as specified by the minister in the instrument making the change.
subsection (1) does not apply,

the minister, under section 39 (2) (b) or (3) (b) of the Act, amends a single tree farm licence by removing land from the area of the licence and adding the land to the area of another tree farm licence or establishing a new tree farm licence, and
an allowable annual cut has been attributed to the area of that land under section 8 (5) (a.1) of the Act,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the allowable annual cut of the

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: tree farm licence area from which the land is removed is, after the removal of the land, the allowable annual cut of the tree farm licence area as it was immediately before the removal of the land minus the allowable annual cut attributed to the area of land removed from the licence,

tree farm licence area to which the land is added, if applicable, is, after the addition of the land, the allowable annual cut of the tree farm licence area as it was immediately before the addition of the land plus the allowable annual cut attributed to the area of land added to the licence, and
new tree farm licence area, if applicable, is the allowable annual cut attributed to the area of land added to establish the new tree farm licence.
subsections (1) and (2) do not apply,

as a result of paragraph (b), the timber harvesting land base of the tree farm licence from which that land is removed decreases by at least 200 hectares,

the tree farm licence area from which the land is removed is, after the removal of the land, the allowable annual cut of the tree farm licence area as it was immediately before the removal of the land minus the amount obtained by applying the following formula:

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Exception for licences entered into for special purposes

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: In this section, licence entered into for special purposes has the same meaning as in section 223 (1) of the Act.

Sections 11 to 12.1 do not apply in relation to a community forest agreement or first nations woodland licence if the community forest agreement or first nations woodland licence is a licence entered into for special purposes.

bcl:section.bcl:marginalnote: Surrender of area-based agreements under Surrender Regulation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an area-based licence is surrendered under section 6 [acceptance of application to surrender agreement] of the Surrender Regulation, the allowable annual cut of the timber supply area in which the licence area is located is, after the surrender takes effect, the allowable annual cut of the timber supply area as it was immediately before the surrender took effect plus the allowable annual cut of the Crown land portion of the licence area as it was immediately before the surrender took effect.
